backgroundColor.comment: The background color of the image expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
blockclockEnabled.comment: Indicates whether results should be sent to a blockclock
blockclockAddress.comment: The IP address of the blockclock on your network
blockclockPassword.comment: The password for the blockclock on your network, leave blank for no password
gridColor.comment: The base color of the grid representing each block during one percent of a halving period, expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
gridDividerFillEnabled.comment: This controls whether the lines between individual grid blocks should be filled as well when blocks are produced.
gridImageEnabled.comment: Indicates whether to render a graphic image into the grid. If enabled, will source images from the ipfsDirectory location, changing to a different image for each whole percent.
gridImageUnminedMode.comment: When gridImageEnabled is True, this controls how unmined blocks should appear.

gridImageUnminedMode.choices.fullcolor: Shows unmined blocks as full color
gridImageUnminedMode.choices.grayscale: Shows unmined blocks in standard grayscale (default)
gridImageUnminedMode.choices.dither: Shows unmined blocks in 1-bit pixels as black and white
gridImageUnminedMode.choices.dither2: Shows unmined blocks in 8-bit pixels as shades of gray

height.comment: The height, in pixels to generate the image.
interval.comment: The amount of time, in seconds, the script should wait before data gathering and image creation again
progressColor.comment: The color to denote progress bar and filled in blocks within a percent of halving period, expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
textColor.comment: The color of the text expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
width.comment: The width, in pixels to generate the image.
